Speaking to me after our co-op hands-on - in which guides writer Kiera made friends with a tree monster only for somebody to shoot it - Inflexion's CEO Aaryn Flynn explained a bit about how the game will evolve during its early access period, which Inflexion estimate will last 9-12 months. Thankfully, it sounds like fine-tuning the UI is a priority, though Flynn is "cautious" about committing to a full-blown roadmap.
 
Read more
articles.title: How Nightingale will change during early access, including UI fixes, combat updates and new biomes

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Every year, there are a couple of game soundtracks I become properly obsessed with. In 2022, I more or less had the music of Tunic and Citizen Sleeper on repeat whenever I left the house. In 2021, it was Chicory. In 2020, it was Coffee Talk and Signs Of The Sojourner, and in 2019, it was all Mutazione, all the time. 2023 was a pretty great year for game music as well, as we not only got Alan Wake 2's exquisite musical set-piece that's honestly just been getting better and more insane as time's gone on, frankly, but also the toe-tappingly brilliant soundtrack of Cobalt Core, which has somehow risen even higher on my forever playlist after revisiting it for this month's RPS Game Club.  
Composed by Aaron Cherof, Cobalt Core's music alternates between high-energy battle tracks and calmer, more relaxed ambience. It's so dang good, and an absolutely perfect backdrop for sliding in and out of oncoming missile fire in its roguelike spaceship fights. So come along and jam to some of its best tracks with me below as I pick out some of my musical highlights.
Read more
articles.title: Cobalt Core isn't just a great game, its soundtrack is also an all-timer

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
A colossal new update for Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader launched last night, hitting the grimdark space-aristocrat RPG with so many changes that the patch notes are almost 17,000 words long. Fitting for a game that our Rogue Trader review called "engrossing, obscure and absolutely exhausting". It adds loads of new voiced lines, fixes everything from wonky abilities to broken quests, reworks balance, improves performance, and so much more. Enough is changed that developers Owlcat are giving everyone in your party a free respec to adjust to what the game has become.
Read more
articles.title: WH40K: Rogue Trader's "first major update" is out, and everyone gets a free respec

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Last Epoch, a Diablo-like action-RPG from Eleventh Hour Games that's been in early access since 2019, finally arrives tomorrow as a full release. And to celebrate, there's a colossal 1.0 update that could take you an hour to read in its entirety. To spare you the time commitment, its highlights include new Acolyte and Rogue masteries, new Item Factions, a full offline mode, controller support, and plenty of visual tweaks.
Read more
articles.title: Last Epoch's 1.0 release patch arrives with a full offline mode, Warlocks and controller support

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The latest Assassin's Creed Mirage update is giving me flashbacks to that inglorious period in game design when every other action game had an insta-fail stealth segment to wind people up between cover-based shoot-outs and, I don't know, three-part glyph puzzles or what-have-you. Out today for PC at 12pm UTC, 1pm GMT, 7am ET and 4am PT, the 1.07 patch adds Full Synchronization Challenge, a permadeath mode (originally teased last year) that not only permakills you when you're slain by enemies, but also deletes your save file when you commit crimes such as slaughtering civilians, or going outside of "authorised map locations".
  
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed: Mirage's new free permadeath mode deletes your save when you break the law

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Xenonauts 2 received its biggest update yet last night, adding a bunch of new things to the early access X-COM-like that will be sure to please your rude Chief Science Officer Gaius Baltar James Callis whatever his name is SMUG FACE. Alongside a brand-new Cruiser UFO to pilfer for new technology to help fight back against your alien invaders, the Milestone 3 update also brings new story missions, weapons and vehicles, extending the campaign's play time from 180 in-game days all the way up to 260.  
Read more
articles.title: Xenonauts 2 gets biggest update yet, adds new UFO, missions and weapons

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: T-Mobile má v plánu své vlastní datacentrum DC7 pokrýt privátní 5G kampusovou sítí, na které si bude moci osahat provoz takového řešení. K čemu je v datacentru taková síť? Kam všude se dá ještě nasadit?
articles.title: Privátní 5G sítě posunou český průmysl, říká Jakub Kopecký z T-Mobile

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Již jsme se setkali s propojením Pythonu s nativními knihovnami naprogramovanými (například) v C. Použili jsme přitom balíček cffi. Ovšem někdy může být užitečné využít namísto toho standardní balíček ctypes.
articles.title: Propojení Pythonu s nativními knihovnami s využitím balíčku ctypes

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: V dnešním díle postřehů se podíváme na bankovní trojan v našich končinách, na Wi-Fi zranitelnosti, na operaci Cronos při níž došlo i na zatýkání kybernetických kriminálníků a na další zajímavosti ze světa IT.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: zatýkání kyberzločinců během operace Cronos

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Prostředí COSMIC brzy vydá své prvnímu vydání pro veřejné testování. Open-source Stavebnice STEMFIE nově podporuje TT motory. Canonical vydala Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS s jádrem Linux 6.5. Firma Slimbook a projekt KDE oznámili KDE Slimbook V.
articles.title: Prostředí COSMIC se blíží, stavebnice STEMFIE podporuje motory

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vychází Ardour 8.4 s řadou novinek, nová verze Wine 9.3 opravuje 23 chyb a vylepšuje ARM, Proton 9.0 Beta přináší podporu dalších her a přechod na nové knihovny.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.0 už pozítří, SDL3 dostává Vulkan Renderer

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Zabýval jsem se modely pro klasifikací elektrokardiografu (EKG) s využitím 1D a 2D konvolučních sítí. V tomto volně navazujícím článku si vyberu jeden z těchto modelů a pokusím se výsledky vylepšit pomocí tzv. Ensemble Learning Methods.
articles.title: Posílení klasifikace EKG

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: GIMP 2.99.18 je na světě a s ním se završuje série vývojových verzí, které vedou projekt k revolučnímu skoku vpřed, k vydání GIMPu 3.0. Novinek je spousta, ale bude to na konkurenci stačit?
articles.title: GIMP 3.0 vyjde v květnu: jaké novinky přinese po deseti letech vývoje?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Václav Steiner)
articles.description: Dnes začneme s obsáhlejším tématem, kterým bude integrace fotovoltaické elektrárny do naší chytré domácnosti tak, abychom ji využili na maximum. Zajistíme integraci střídače a nastavíme automatizaci.
articles.title: Home Assistant: řídíme efektivní práci fotovoltaické elektrárny

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ve druhém článku o knihovně Toolz, která podporuje funkcionální paradigma v jazyku Python, dokončíme popis podbalíčku itertoolz, jenž obsahuje funkce (a vlastně nic jiného než funkce) určené pro zpracování a analýzu sekvencí.
articles.title: Funkcionální programování v Pythonu s využitím knihovny Toolz (2. část)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V pravidelné středeční softwarové sondě si představíme nástroj pro práci s velkými jazykovými modely (LLM), budeme analyzovat šachové hry a vyzkoušíme další z řady vizuálního nástrojů pro práci s gitem.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (21. 2. 2024): pracujte s jazykovými modely či mnoha obrázky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: svatas)
articles.description: Beta testeři nové verze iOS označené 17.4 beta 2 začali hlásit, že PWA aplikace nefungují. Projevuje se to omezením funkčnosti těchto aplikací, které se stávají nepoužitelnými. PWA znamená Progressive Web App a jde o přechod mezi webovou a nativní aplikací v operačním systému.
articles.title: Apple v systému iOS omezil PWA aplikace v EU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nedlouho poté, co se specifikací Vulkan 1,3,277 přišla na svět i akcelerace dekódování video formátu AV1 skrze Vulkan Video, je připravena další implementace, tentokrát v rámci ovladače RADV.
articles.title: Mesa 24.1 přinese akceleraci AV1 přes Vulkan Video s ovladačem RADV

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: S příchodem KDE Plasmy 6.0 stavějící na frameworku Qt6 se tak trochu váže i nová verze správce SDDM 0.21. Ta navazuje na loňskou letní verzi 0.20, která s Waylandem koketovala ve více experimentální podobě, což nadále platí i pro SDDM 0.21, jakkoli práce opět notně pokročily.
articles.title: SDDM 0.21 vylepšuje podporu Waylandu a Qt6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: CEO Nvidie Jensen Huang na World Government Summit v Dubaji řekl, že děti už se nemají učit programovat. Umělá inteligence může nahradit programování s použitím lidského vstupu. Tedy AI zabije programování.
articles.title: CEO Nvidie: děti už se nemají učit programovat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V sobotu vyšel kompresní nástroj XZ Utils ve verzi 5.6.0. Mezi novinky patří téměř dokonalá podpora cmake. Oproti autotools již chybí jen spuštění některých testů. Při použití CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release se nyní použije přepínač -O2 místo -O3. Jednak není -O3 v případě XZ rychlejší a také výsledná binárka je větší.
articles.title: XZ Utils 5.6.0 s podporou cmake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Zajímá vás do hloubky, jaké možnosti monitorování Windows serveru poskytuje nejen nová verze Zabbixu 7.0? Ve čtvrtek 29. února od 10:00 do 12:00 na bezplatném webináři vám své hluboké znalosti o této problematice předvede zkušený lektor Alois Zadražil.
articles.title: Webinař zdarma: pokročilý monitoring Windows serveru Zabbixem 7.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před dvěma týdny se prodejní automat firmy M&M v kampusu univerzity ve Waterloo v Kanadě zasekl. To by ještě nebylo nic zvláštního, ale kolemjdoucí studentka SquidKid47 vyfotila chybovou hlášku, ve které je zmíněna chyba v aplikaci Invenda.Vending.FacialRecog­nitionApp.exe.
articles.title: Prodejní automat rozpoznává obličeje?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 2. a 3. dubna. Školení proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti a můžete se ho zúčastnit i online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O pokusném jádru 6.6 pro Raspberry Pi jsme tu již psali. Dříve bylo potřeba sudo rpi-update next.  Nyní je potřebný příkaz jen  sudo rpi-update.
articles.title: Pokusné jádro 6.6 pro Raspberry Pi je blíže k vydání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera vyšlo Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS, jde o poslední vydání před 24.04 LTS, které má podle plánu vyjít v dubnu. Obsahuje HWE (Hardware Enablement Stack) s jádrem 6.5 a grafickou knihovnou mesa 23.2 z Ubuntu 23.10. Jelikož HWE bylo vydáno již v lednu, tak nové jádro patrně již máte. Ale v oficiálních obrazech ještě nebylo.
articles.title: Vyšlo Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS, poslední před 24.04 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Americká FTC (Federal Trade Commission) ve středu uložila české firmě Avast pokutu 16,5 miliónů dolarů a zároveň má zákaz prodávat data uživatelů o prohlížení webu. Avastu je vytýkáno, že porušil práva uživatelů tím, že sbíral a ukládal data o prohlížení webu bez jejich vědomí a souhlasu. Přitom produkt, který toto dělal, byl vydáván za ochranu před sledováním na webu.
articles.title: Avast dostal pokutu přes 16 miliónů dolarů a nesmí prodávat data uživatelů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Nginx je dnes přibližně na třetině web serverů na internetu a toto číslo stále roste. Je výkonný, spolehlivý, má spoustu funkcí a dobře se spravuje. Pokud potřebujete dobrý web server pro svůj projekt, bude Nginx správnou volbou.
articles.title: Nasaďte moderní web server s Nginx (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Příští týden by mělo být vydáno desktopové prostředí KDE Plasma 6 a ještě předtím byl oznámen KDE Slimbook V, nejnovější notebook vytvořený ve spolupráci projektu KDE a společnosti Slimbook. Tento linuxový notebook přijde s předinstalovaným prostředím Plasma 6.0 již v základní výbavě.
articles.title: KDE Slimbook V s procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 7840HS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: honyczek)
articles.description: Vývojáři GCompris vydali novou verzi aplikace označenou jako 4.0. Tato verze zahrnuje 190 aktivit pro děti od 2 do 10 let. V těchto aktivitách se děti mohou učit základům ovládání počítače, procvičovat čtení, logiku, aritmetiku a dále zkoumat vědecké pokusy či poznávat svět.
articles.title: GCompris 4.0 přináší nové aktivity a sjednocený grafický návrh

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ministerstvo zahraničí Spojených států vyhlásilo finanční odměnu ve výši až 15 milionů dolarů (345 milionů korun) za informace, které by mohly vést k identifikaci klíčových vůdců skupiny stojící za ransomwarem LockBit a k zatčení osob podílejících se na jeho provozu.
articles.title: Spojené státy nabízejí odměnu 15 milionů dolarů za dopadení původců ransomwaru LockBit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým Sysdig Threat Research Team (TRT) objevil nový malware nazvaný SSH-Snake. Popisují jej jako samomodifikujícího se červa, který se od jiných řešení odlišuje tím, že se vyhýbá vzorcům typickým pro skriptované útoky. Díky tomu se mu daří v systémech velmi dobře schovat.
articles.title: Malware SSH-Snake hledá klíče k SSH a pak se šíří po síti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Štrobl)
articles.description: Platform engineering je pro mnoho lidí jakýsi buzzword. Kromě toho je to také téma dalšího meetupu Cloud Native Prague, který je již desátý v pořadí. Setkání bude tentokráte ve formátu panelové diskuze, kdy přivítáme čtyři skvělé mluvčí. Budou debatovat o tom, co vlastně Platform Engineering je a jak se vypořádali s jeho zákoutími.
articles.title: Cloud Native Prague #10: Platform Engineering

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Do linuxového jádra začaly přicházet první úpravy zahrnující podporu procesorů a platformy IBM Power11, které umožní v Linuxu použít novou generace procesorů Power. Před několika měsíci začala společnost IBM zveřejňovat záplaty „PowerPC Future“ pro kompilátor GCC. Už tehdy se předpokládalo, že jde o podporu Power11, protože IBM už takto dříve nazývala podporu pro Power10 ještě před oficiálním představení těchto procesorů.
articles.title: IBM pracuje na podpoře architektury Power11 v linuxovém jádře

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili GIMP 2.99.18, což je poslední plánovaná vývojová verze před očekávaným vydáním dekádu připravovaného GIMPu 3.0. Vývojáři pracují na vylepšené práci s barvami, vylepšených algoritmech barev, na možnosti nedestruktivních úprav, vylepšení práce s písmy, automatickém rozšiřování vrstev, lepší práci se soubory Adobe PSD a dalších novinkách.
articles.title: GIMP 3.0 má poslední vývojářskou verzi, měl by vyjít v květnu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mozilla dnes zahajuje kampaň Privacy for All (Soukromí pro všechny), jejímž cílem je celosvětově zlepšit standardy ochrany osobních údajů a položit základy pro úspěšnou regulaci umělé inteligence. Ochrana soukromí a umělá inteligence jsou podle Mozilly neoddělitelně spjaty. Závody ve zbrojení v oblasti umělé inteligence motivují společnosti k tomu, aby shromažďovaly co nejvíce dat pro získání konkurenční výhody, aniž by braly ohled na soukromí lidí. Abychom měli důvěryhodnou umělou inteligenci, musíme o soukromí přemýšlet z globální perspektivy. Data neznají hranice, vysvětluje Mozilla svou motivaci.
articles.title: Mozilla spouští kampaň Privacy for All, zaměřuje se na soukromí a umělou inteligenci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Komunikační platforma Signal přichází se změnami týkajícími se soukromí uživatelů. Vaše telefonní číslo už nebude ve výchozím nastavení viditelné pro všechny, se kterými komunikujete. Lidé, kteří mají vaše číslo uložené v kontaktech svého telefonu, ho stále uvidí, protože ho už stejně znají.
articles.title: Signal umožní skrýt telefonní číslo a používat přezdívku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Do Git větve balíku Mesa budoucí verze 24.1 zamířil kód implementující úvodní část infrastruktury podporující možnost ovladačů určit, zdali pro běh OpenGL použijí Zink (tedy „OpenGL-on-Vulkan“), namísto obvyklého nativního OpenGL. Cílem je u nových GPU Nvidia podporovat právě cestu běhu OpenGL na Vulkanu skrze ovladač Nvidia NVK.
articles.title: Na novějších GPU bude nouveau pro OpenGL používat Zink a NVK

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Po Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefoxu či LibreOffice je WebKitGTK, tedy port WebKitu pro GTK, dalším projektem, který plánuje přechod na vykreslování přes Googlem vyvíjenou knihovnu Skia. Ta umožňuje využívat jak GPU akceleraci přes ANGLE a Vulkan, tak softwarovou CPU rasterizaci tam, kde tato API nejsou k dispozici.
articles.title: WebKitGTK také nasadí vykreslování přes knihovnu Skia

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Fraunhofer Institute vydal novou verzi své otevřené implementace kodéru do standardu videa H.266 alias VVC. VVenC 1.11 přináší další výkonnostní optimalizace.

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na internetu píšou, že začít s automatizací správy serverů můžete do půl hodiny. Dokážeme vám, že s Ansible to je pravda. Stačí navštívit naše pražské školení Ansible – úvod do automatizace a pak navazující Ansible – role a AWX.
articles.title: Ansible: úvod do automatizace, role a AWX (školení)

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acronis Cyber Protect 16 přináší nové standardy kybernetické bezpečnosti a ochrany dat. Zranitelná místa má každá firma. Zabránit tomu nelze, je třeba s tím pracovat. Acer na trh uvádí nové notebooky řady Swift s procesory AMD Ryzen řady 8040 s umělou inteligencí Ryzen. AI Days s Nvidia pod taktovkou M Computers. Umělá inteligence bude v roce 2024 nejsilnějším motorem produktivity vývojářů. Státy omezují výstavbu datových center, vadí jim obrovská spotřeba energie.

articles.description: Altermagnety kombinují přednosti feromagnetů a antiferomagnetů. Vyhlášeno výběrové řízení na první kvantový počítač v ČR. Hory na neutronových hvězdách. Cesta ke štěpným zdrojům energie pro Měsíc. S životem na Titanu se prý moc počítat nedá.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Vědci experimentálně potvrdili altermagnetismus

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: PC nové generace budou podporovat spouštění umělé inteligence na klientovi. MSP Horizons: 97 % partnerů očekává růst v oblasti řízených IT služeb. Kybernetická bezpečnost je pro fungování zdravotnictví klíčová. Pro klasické pevné disky přichází bod zlomu. Supravodivá elektroda může ovládat spinové vlny.

articles.description: Křemíkovo-uhlíková baterie druhé generace. Poprvé měli objevit konce vláken temné hmoty. Balení konečného počtu koulí a klobásová katastrofa. Podzemní oceán má i maličký měsíc Mimas.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nový časový krystal vydrží velmi dlouho

articles.description: Zde máte opět příležitost k návštěvě Goodoffer24.com. Jde o stránky, které naízejí čtenářům výhodu. Ta stojí za úvahu, zejména co se týče ceny nákupu nezbytného softwaru pro jejich PC, ať už jde o profesionální použití, nebo jen o udržení rodinného rozpočtu v rozumných mezích. Tato nabídka Microsoft Office je perfektním řešením pro jakoukouliv potřebu, s kompletním softwarovým balíkem, který může zajistit provedení práce.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Více než čtvrtina firem zakázala používání generativní umělé inteligence. Zločinci využívají nástroje na kyberútoky formou služby a globálně rozšiřují podvody s kryptoměn. Budoucnost jsou sice jedničky a nuly, ale s podporou kvantových výpočtů. Ani vícefaktorové ověřování nemusí uživatelský účet zabezpečit. Kyberzločinci útočí MFA phishingem. Klíčem k úspěchu umělé inteligence je důvěra.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Více než čtvrtina firem zakázala používání generativní umělé inteligence

articles.description: By default the AArch64 kernel on Ubuntu and other Linux distributions tend to default to a standard 4K page size but for newer AArch64 hardware especially in the server/HPC space, there can be great benefits to using a 64K page size. As it's been a while since I last ran any 64-bit ARM 4K vs. 64K kernel page size benchmarks, while having remote access to the NVIDIA GH200 I ran a fresh comparison for looking at the performance advantages to switching over to a 64K page size kernel. These new 64K kernel numbers are shown alongside the recent AMD EPYC and Intel Xeon CPU reference benchmark results for a look at how the 4K vs. 64K page size affects the overall computing landscape.
articles.title: 64K Kernel Page Size Performance Benefits For HPC Shown With NVIDIA's GH200 Grace CPU

articles.description: The Linux kernel has supported the Intel Hardware Feedback Interface "HFI" via the "intel_hfi" driver since 2022 for bettering supporting Core hybrid processors. The Intel HFI can be used for communicating performance and energy efficiency capabilities of individual CPU cores of the system. In turn the Linux kernel can leverage Intel HFI details for better task placement among the available CPU cores/threads. With a new patch series, the Intel HFI driver can "save tons of CPU cycles" by only enabling it when needed...
articles.title: Intel HFI Driver Can "Save Tons Of CPU Cycles" By Only Enabling Itself When Needed

articles.description: Ubuntu/Canonical has for a while now promoted the prospects of Rust programming within the Linux kernel and one of their kernel engineers, Andrea Righi, wrote a Rust-written Linux scheduler with promising results that leverages eBPF for dynamically loading it at run-time. While Ubuntu isn't yet committing to using it as part of their distribution, appearing on the Ubuntu blog today was more praise for the work and even talking about the potential for a "micro-kernel design" in the future via leveraging Rust and eBPF...

articles.author: Smangaliso Simelane
articles.description:
After 13 long years, Remedy's Alan Wake finally received a sequel, and it has been a success, managing to sell a million units by December 2023. 


Unlike its predecessor, Alan Wake 2 is a survival horror title with a mind-bending narrative and settings that are downright psychedelic at times. The creators of the game answered questions from fans in a Reddit AMA on February 27, and as one might expect, plenty wanted to know more about Initiation 4: We Sing. They got their answers from Nathalie Jankie, Marko Muikku, and John Crossland.


Chucking a musical sequence into a survival horror game is unconventional, but Remedy managed to pull it off, with Sam Lake and Ilkka Villi pulling off their best moves to the sound of the fictional band Old Gods of Asgard. It's not just a musical, however,…
articles.title: Remedy discusses how Initiation 4: We Sing in Alan Wake 2 was designed

articles.author: Tim Harding
articles.description:
Skilled-based matchmaking has been an ongoing topic of conversation in the Call of Duty community for a while. 


For obvious reasons, it's a necessity that prevents lower-skilled players from quitting or just having an awful experience. However, it also makes playing any style of Call of Duty, other than "sweaty," downright impossible for more skilled players. The game's servers recently had some serious issues for a day, and part of those problems stopped skilled-based matchmaking (SBMM) from working properly.


When the servers were down, so was skilled-based matchmaking


On February 23, millions of players logged into their Modern Warfare 3 accounts and found a few surprises. Their player level was reset to 1, the Zombies mode wouldn't work, and loadouts were disabled. It was a mess t…
articles.title: Call of Duty server issues broke skill-based matchmaking for a day, and players loved it

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
If you haven't played Black Mesa, the unofficial (yet wholly endorsed by Valve) remake of Half-Life, it's definitely worth checking out. For those of us who have played – and enjoyed – it, the team responsible for it is teasing a new game that's currently in the pipeline.


A video uploaded to YouTube by developer Crowbar Collective (thanks, GamesRadar) gives us just 22 seconds of something the studio is working on. All we get is the company logo followed by a colorful symbol that leaves us non the wiser. And that's it.




If you want to keep up-to-date with what the developer is working on, you're encouraged to sign up to the mailing list. Suffice it to say, it's impossible to know what the project is, but I bet you'll have your own theories.


It's probably not Half-Life 3


It could be a brand-new IP from Crowbar Collective. However, for all we know, it could be another remake. Perhaps of the sequel or some other classic FPS. Who knows? Not I, that's the point I'm making.


As for Black Mesa, it was in development for years before it finally came out in an official capacity in 2020. It rebuilds the original Half-Life from the ground up, complete with fresh voice acting.


It also tinkered with the OG a little bit. In order to keep diehard fans on their toes, some parts were tweaked or changed in certain respects. It also improved on the Xen aspect of the game, which some feel was lacking somewhat in Half-Life. Again, worth checking out if you're a fan of the original.

The post Studio behind the Half-Life remake Black Mesa teases a new project appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Studio behind the Half-Life remake Black Mesa teases a new project

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
When the end of the world comes (and it will), I like to imagine that in the midst of all the rubble and chaos, people will still be playing Skyrim. There doesn't seem to be any way that people won't tinker with the game and in this instance, we get to see dead technology being revived in order to play TES5.


As spotted by PCGamesN, Reddit user nekomichi recently showed that it's possible to run the game in a Steam Deck (so far so normal) using old iPods as controllers. The clip attached to the post shows it working as you would imagine.




Movement itself requires scrolling the click wheel of the one on the right, while the left iPod is being used for turning. While walking forward and fighting seem to work pretty well, turning left and right is a bit of a janky affair.


Not intended for speedruns


This idea is actually based on something nekomichi did in November 2022. A video on YouTube shows them setting up some iPods to control Skyrim via PC. Basically, it involves the installation of RockBox, an open source piece of firmware which allows the iPods to be used as devices over a USB.


Once installed, it becomes a case of assigning each button and wheel to an action in-game. The method used in the video is almost certainly the same that's used in the Steam Deck version (what is a Steam Deck if not a portable PC, after all).


They've also tested this on Sleeping Dogs, also running on the Deck. However, they say it works much better with Skyrim. There's no reason why you can't try this yourself if you happen to have some old iPods flying around. But don't expect to be speedrunning through the game.

The post Here’s Skyrim on a Steam Deck, controlled by iPods appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Here’s Skyrim on a Steam Deck, controlled by iPods

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
While Forza Motorsport fans eagerly anticipate the seemingly game-changing Update 6, Forza Horizon 5 continues its assortment of wacky hijinks by introducing dinosaurs into its roster of usable assets. The game's major Eurotrip update is, therefore, particularly eclectic, and bound to thrill players this way or the other.


Notably, the Horizon Festival is now being overtaken by a fleet of European vehicles, from top-tier Bentleys to classic AMG Hammer wagons, and they're being joined by lovingly recreated dinosaur props. Indeed, players will now be able to use an assortment of dinosaurs for their custom tracks, adding yet another layer of zaniness to the already wild and wacky Horizon franchise. 


Image via Playground Games


Forza Horizon 5's Eurotrip season has dinosaurs in tow


Of co…
articles.title: Forza Horizon 5’s European Takeover introduces… dinosaurs

articles.author: Smangaliso Simelane
articles.description:
Pokemon has always diversified the ways you can explore its world, with Pokemon TCG being one of them. During today's Pokemon Presents, the company revealed Pokemon Pocket, an upcoming new way to enjoy the trading card game. 


Although Pokemon TCG Online already exists, Pokemon TCG Pocket will introduce new elements that'll appeal to players who aren't particularly invested in the competitive side of things and take more delight in the artwork of the cards. 


The game will allow you to open digital packs and feel the excitement of discovering what new cards you can add to your collection on your mobile device. On your hunt for your favorite cards, you'll also be able to trade with other players also hoping to perfect their collection. 


Experience Pokemon TCG like never before


Screenshot by Destructoid.


The upcoming game is being developed via a three-way collaboration with Creatures Inc., the Pokemon Company, and DeNA which a company also involved with Pokemon Masters EX.


According to the CEO of Creatures Inc., Yuji Kitano, care is being taken to show off the cards with effects only available digitally. One of the ways this is being done is through an immersive experience that lets you leap into the illustrations, which should be a blast when applied to full art and rare cards.  




The competitive element of Pokemon TCG hasn't been eliminated, and you'll still be able to battle with friends. However, Kitano explains that the rules have been streamlined to allow for quick battles. 


We don't have details regarding any monetization strategies, though it is revealed that you'll be able to open two packs a day for free. It launches in 2024, so TCG fans should prepare for the all-new experience coming soon. 

The post Pokemon TCG goes digital again with Pokemon TCG Pocket appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Pokemon TCG goes digital again with Pokemon TCG Pocket

articles.author: Cameron Woolsey
articles.description:
After more than two weeks of hammered servers and lengthy queues, Helldivers 2 players and developer Arrowhead have a reason to collectively sigh in relief. Helldivers 2 server issues seem to have finally let up during the weekend, and now the studio is ready to go back to the "original plan" and prep new content.


That's not to say that the weekend was quiet, oh no. Arrowhead CEO Johan Pilestedt predicted on X (Twitter) that divers would reach the 800,000 player cap over the weekend. It may have accomplished just that, as more than 450,000 players answered the call of Super Earth on Steam alone. 


On February 25, Pilestedt wrote he was "happy and proud" of the team and that the servers stayed online "without problem." Pilestedt continued by saying it's time for the developer to go back to the "original plan," and that there are "exciting things" in the works.




Helldiver 604958, going dark


By "exciting things," we're hoping he's talking about the mech suits. Mechs were teased at the end of a trailer before the game launched. There's no word on when we'll get the suits, but the trailer mentioned they would be arriving "soon after launch." Now that waitlists are hopefully behind us, we may soon see which 'metal boxes with legs and guns' are best between the Helldivers and Automatons. 


But that's not all. Before the February 25 message, Pilestedt teased some possible content that could be on its way. In a reply on X to a post about stealth gameplay, Pilestedt wrote he "used to rock subsonic ammo and suppressor" during playtests. He refused to elaborate before dropping an Eagle Smoke Strike and disappearing. 




Whether you play Helldivers 2 loud and proud or dream of going at it quietly, it looks like all players should have more to look forward to shortly.

The post Helldivers 2 server woes ease up, encouraging Arrowhead to return to the ‘original plan’ appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Helldivers 2 server woes ease up, encouraging Arrowhead to return to the ‘original plan’

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The Pokémon Company aired its official 2024 Pokémon Presents presentation today, and it closed it out with some good news. Another Pokémon Legends is on the way, dubbed Pokémon Legends Z-A, and it's currently scheduled for 2025.


Today's teaser trailer shows Pikachu running through a blueprinted city, where many different Pokémon are hanging out. Eventually, the text reveals the "Urban Redevelopment Plan" for Lumiose City - a central location in the Kalos region, the home of Pokémon X and Y.


Pokemon Legends Z-A, as it appears to be called, is a new entry in the Legends series and could be an interesting look at the origins of another beloved locale.




Legends among us


Legends started off with Pokémon Legends Arceus in 2022, as an interesting side-branch of the mainline series. Transporting its protagonist back in time to the early days of the Diamond and Pearl region, it was much more focused on catching, collecting, and exploring.


And to its credit, Pokémon Legends Arceus was pretty well-received. Now, especially after the troubles that Scarlet and Violet went through, a Legends game might be a good stop-gap for franchise woes.


Importantly, Z-A is not launching until 2025. While it could be an early launch for that year—Arceus was a January game—that still means we're now looking at a year without a new Pokémon entry, as S/V has wrapped its DLC. Hopefully the gap is a good thing. But it does make me curious about what the Switch's holiday lineup will look like for 2024.

The post A new Pokémon Legends game is on the way for 2025 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: A new Pokémon Legends game is on the way for 2025

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Sony Interactive Entertainment has announced today that the corporation will cut around 8% of its workforce, or more than 900 jobs. Also, in the announcement, they stated that PlayStation Studios London will be closing.


There are two separate statements, one from President and CEO Jim Ryan and the other from Head of PlayStation Studios Herman Hulst. Both are full of standard executive-speak, but they provide slightly different insights. For example, Hulst’s statement clarifies that US groups affected will include, “Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, as well as our Technology, Creative, and Support teams,” as well as Europe’s “Guerrilla and Firesprite.”


However, Jim Ryan goes further to say, “There will be impact for employees across all SIE regions – Americas, EMEA, Japan, and APAC.” 


Hul…
articles.title: Sony announces it’s cutting about 900 jobs, closing London studio

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Final Fantasy VII was released in 1997 on PlayStation. In those days, the NES, despite Nintendo only discontinuing it in 1995, was considered practically ancient. Things aged faster in the ‘90s.


By the time the PlayStation had passed into antiquity in the aughts, the denizens of Web 2.0 became aware of a Famicom/NES demake of Final Fantasy VII. Since Final Fantasy VII was still fondly remembered and the retro gamer identity was reaching its maturity, this was a fascinating topic of conversation. Just hearing about it took your imagination to interesting places.


It was certainly fascinating to me. I didn’t know enough about the backend of video games to really have an idea for how this was possible; a 3-disc epic on a diminutive cartridge. What radical magic!


I never took the time to …
articles.title: Final Fantasy 7 Demake for Famicom requires imagination, familiarity, and patience

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
When I bring up the "tactics RPG," it feels like there is a certain image that comes to mind: grid-based, turn-based, isometric, or top-down, with units hopping up and down terrain to bonk each other on the head with swords and magic. The sheer popularity of games like Final Fantasy Tactics, Tactics Ogre, and Fire Emblem have cemented as much.


Maybe this is my own biases speaking, but hearing "(insert name here) Tactics" immediately brings that image to mind, and it's held true for several variations of tactical spin-offs. After playing the demo for Unicorn Overlord, Vanillaware's latest, it is clearly falling in the strategy side of the genre; rather than another Tactics, it's hearkening back to a different branch of the Ogre series: Ogre Battle.


It's a really interesting approach to …
articles.title: Unicorn Overlord demo rekindles an old strategy flame

articles.author: Randy Marr
articles.description:
Whether it bumps up our numbers or matches our shiny new boots: we crave new loot in video games. To help satiate our hunger, the most recent legendary weapon in World of Warcraft is now more likely to drop than ever. Even failed attempts now move you closer towards actually seeing the axe fall into your hands.


Blizzard recently announced that it has buffed the "Bad Luck Protection" system for this legendary axe, Fyr'alath. This is designed to make you more likely to get the weapon with each defeat of the expansion's big bad, Fyrakk. Whenever you fail to get the axe directly, you'll receive an item that increases your next chance. These "Embers of Fyr'alath" grant a vague, but invisible buff to your character. We don't know exactly what the Embers do to increase your shots of seeing the …
articles.title: World of Warcraft’s current legendary, Fyr’alath, buffed to drop more often

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
The elite Valkyries' adventures continue in Honkai Impact 3rd's upcoming chapter, Mars Crisis. This time, we'll see new faces join the team, from the eccentric Senadina to the animalistic Coralie 6626 Planck.


If you have always wanted to go on a heroic deep space escapade, now is the perfect time to begin as Honkai Impact 3rd kicks off Part 2 on February 29. You won't stray too far from our solar system as the team sets out on a quest to Mars. That means HoYoverse longtime players can look forward to all-new missions, locations to explore, and challenges to overcome.


Even those who have yet to play Part 1 and 1.5 won't get too lost in the lore, considering that Part 2 begins a different path. On top of that, every battle will increase the thrill, and you must take advantage of your team's kit to unleash brutal blows to new galactic enemies. 




New combat features head to the HoYoverse RPG with the update, too. The Astral Ring, one of Honaki's new battle mechanics, allows you to collect energy in battle, resulting in more damage rates toward foes. You can also take things to the skies through aerial combat, where you can even land a few gnarly combos. 


However, it won't always be so hectic in the world of Honkai Impact 3rd Part 2, thanks to the explorative features throughout Mars. Not only will these travels help you grow as a team, but the sights will be stunning to look at with its next-generation graphics. 


Currently, the game is only available for PC and mobile, with Mac functionality expected to come. If you want an early start, you can sign up for pre-registration to get you all set for launch day. More events will arrive shortly after the release of Honkai Impact 3rd Part 2, bringing you rewards both in-game and in real life.

The post Honkai Impact 3rd embarks on a new chapter with Part 2, Mars Crisis, this month appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Honkai Impact 3rd embarks on a new chapter with Part 2, Mars Crisis, this month

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
Did you pop in Final Fantasy XV only to hitch your Regalia permanently to Galdin Quay? Did you halt progress in Sea of Stars in an effort to filet every single species known to man? If you're a total fishing freak, there's an open-world action-RPG on the way for you called Sea Fantasy. 


Developed by METASLA, Sea Fantasy is a top-down game with a pixel art aesthetic that promises an "Otherworldly Fishing Open World RPG." It also says you can "save the world by fishing!," which might not sound quite as chill as sitting by the dock of the bay should be. That's because there's a slightly darker twist here, as you aim to fish for the world's marine life — known as SeaAZ — while kicking off a story in which the end of the world is imminent. 


Sea Fantasy currently has a projected release window set for February 2025 on PC and as-yet-unspecified consoles. While most of METASLA's first trailer is all about fishing, you can get a glimpse at the larger story that threatens to unfurl near the end. 




Imagine dragons (if you dare)


Just how "epic" will this tale be? The Steam page doesn't dive too much deeper into what to expect, but did you see those dragons at the end of the trailer? Yep, you just got sucked into a fishing game only to be tricked into going on an adventure! It's a real RPG reversal, or so it seems. What we know so far is that you'll be able to hop on a ship and explore the open world freely, and dive into dungeons in search of treasure. You'll have to avoid traps along the way, of course. Lest you forget, as the devs put it, "this is not a peaceful fishing game." 


On the other hand, you could also just catch a ton of fish and use the crafting system to make new rods and hooks. Maybe you'll be able to ignore all those pesky world-saving pleas for a while like every other RPG adventurer worth their salt. Dragons can wait; the door on my sign clearly says "Gone Fishin'."

The post Sea Fantasy is an Oops! All Fishing RPG for the reel ’em in sickos out there appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sea Fantasy is an Oops! All Fishing RPG for the reel ’em in sickos out there

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
News of Stardew Valley's 1.6 update has circulated since ConcernedApe revealed a major sneak peek in September and various mini-announcements, such as one in October and another 1.6 progress report in December. Today, ConcernedApe announced an official 1.6 release date, with this update releasing on March 19 on PC and later on console and mobile.


According to ConcernedApe's initial announcement tweet, the PC release date for Stardew Valley 1.6 is March 19. He also highlights that console and mobile will "follow as soon as possible". In short, while there are no official dates for other platforms, we know the update is coming, and it's coming quickly. 




Stardew Valley 1.6 primarily focuses on changes throughout both the early and end-game, including new festivals, late-game content that covers all skill areas, and various dialogue additions. It'll also include new items, crafting recipes, villager winter outfits, and a new starting farm type, among other improvements to expand on the game's pre-existing features. 


Stardew Valley's last major content update, the 1.5 update, launched over four years ago in 2020 and featured new additions such as Ginger Island, the Beach Farm layout, and remixed Community Center bundles to add variety to your playthrough. Update 1.6 is seemingly similar in size and complexity, potentially adding more than the previous update.


While ConcernedApe's latest post reveals that PC players will receive this update in three weeks on March 19, there's currently no word on when console and mobile players will unlock it. If it follows the same timeline as previous updates, console players will likely receive it shortly after those on PC, with it arriving on mobile sometime after.

The post Stardew Valley 1.6 arrives first for PC in March, with consoles and mobile later appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Stardew Valley 1.6 arrives first for PC in March, with consoles and mobile later

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
Many of us grew to know most parts of the original Final Fantasy VII by heart, and that's both awesome and heartbreaking. But how many of us are aware of the full extent of the Compilation of Final Fantasy VII extended universe that Square Enix kickstarted in the mid-aughts, in celebration of its seventh anniversary? 


I sure wasn't for a long while, but now I feel like I'm ready to talk about this wackily ambitious attempt at multiplatform, multi-genre, multi-generational storytelling.




Final Fantasy 7: The First Soldier: Thirty years before FF7


Even though The First Soldier takes place long before everything else in the series, it only came out in 2021, seemingly in an attempt to make bank on the battle royale craze. 


Yeah, you got that right. First Soldier is a battle royale tit…
articles.title: An abridged timeline of Final Fantasy 7, ahead of Rebirth

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
Danish studio Die Gute Fabrik, responsible for indie titles such as the excellently unique indie Mutazione, has announced that the company is halting production of current projects. The studio points to the current "challenging funding and investment scene" in games as the big reason behind the decision.




The studio's statement goes on to say that the company stopped production on February 19, and used its remaining money to help the team with a month of paid time.


The most important part, however, is that the studio isn't giving up on trying to find funding to resume production. They're only issuing this public statement to give a proper signal boost to the team members who are now looking for new jobs. Below the announcement, the studio also shared its hiring sheet.




Die Gute Fab…
articles.title: Mutazione studio Die Gute Fabrik is halting production

articles.author: Gabran Gray
articles.description:
In yet another round of bad news for the gaming industry, Until Dawn and The Dark Pictures developer Supermassive Games is about to be hit by a wave of layoffs. 


As reported by Bloomberg, the studio has notified 150 employees that their jobs are potentially being cut in the near future. Supermassive Games is expected to lay off 90 employees, just under a third of its approximately 300 person team. 


The company tweeted out a statement addressing the upcoming changes and the process it's undergoing to decide which positions are being removed. As part of the move, the company said, “We are entering into a period of consultation, which we anticipate will result in the loss of some of our colleagues.” The company said it plans to “focus our efforts on our core strengths and upcoming titles.” 




Supermassive Games is the company behind some spectacular horror games like Until Dawn. The studio released another horror hit, The Quarry, in 2022, the same year that the company was acquired by Nordisk Games, and is currently working on Little Nightmares 3 and a new horror game set in the Dead by Daylight universe.


Working in the video game industry is never easy, but it feels particularly rough out there right now. In 2023 we saw roughly 9,000 layoffs in the gaming industry. The effects ripple out beyond just game developers, with companies like Twitch also being affected. Unfortunately, 2024 doesn’t seem to be bucking that trend anytime soon. In January alone we saw layoffs and canceled games from developers like Black Forest Games and Eidos Montreal. Supermassive Games is the latest studio to get hit with layoffs, but it seems unlikely to be the last.

The post Supermassive Games is set to undergo layoffs appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Supermassive Games is set to undergo layoffs

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
FuRyu and Natsume Atari have announced that action RPG Reynatis will be arriving in North America this Fall. It’s set for Switch, PS4, PS5, and PC.


The press release makes a big deal about Reynatis being set in a “painstakingly-recreated streets of Shibuya, Tokyo.” A trailer was released alongside the announcement. It’s one of the most ridiculous videos I think I’ve seen since the new Death Stranding reveal. It shows Shibuya government police wizards that maybe fight drug addicts.




One of the first things the Reynatis trailer puts on screen is, “Only by overcoming our fear of idiosyncrasies can we free our true selves,” which is just the most pretentious way to say very little.


I can dig it. FuRyu, as a developer of alternative games, is a bit all over the place with its output. However, the art design and even the ridiculously over-the-top dialogue and narrative setup all kind of pop. The game shifts from the “painstakingly recreated” Shibuya to more abstract places that, I’m guessing, are dungeons. Combat looks pretty Musou-like, which can be hit-and-miss when it comes to application.


Something to keep your eye on, at least. It does, after all, feature the incredible Yoko Shimomura as a composer.


Reynatis will be coming to Switch, PS4, PS5, and PC. Its release date is currently planned for sometime in Fall 2024.

The post Reynatis is a new action RPG from FuRyu arriving this fall appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Reynatis is a new action RPG from FuRyu arriving this fall

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Riot Games has revealed the next set for its popular strategy auto battler Teamfight Tactics. Titled Inkborn Fables, the new set brings players to a mystical and ancient world filled with mythological creatures and legendary heroes. Patch 14.6, which begins the new Inkborn Fables set, goes live for PC and mobile on March 20, 2024.




I've had a lot of fun with the current TFT set, Remix Rumble. However, the release date for Inkborn Fables is at right around the four-month mark with Remix Rumble which is the standard lifespan for sets at the moment.


As is usual with new sets, Inkborn Fables will introduce new champions, mechanics, traits, augments, cosmetics, and a new Season Pass. Even though the teaser trailer above is brief and doesn't show any gameplay, there are more than likely some hints about some of the things we can expect in the new set. The beautifully painted scrolls depict mystical beasts as well as some pretty fantastical renditions of certain champions from the Runeterra universe including what I'm pretty sure was Janna and Teemo.


Oh, and you want me to think the Rammus picture on the wall is just there for show? As my spiked shell friend would say: "Okay."


Teamfight Tactics: Inkborn Fables will be released on PC and mobile on March 20, 2024, as a free update

The post Teamfight Tactics: Inkborn Fables gets mystical in 11th game update out next month appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Teamfight Tactics: Inkborn Fables gets mystical in 11th game update out next month

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
According to the official scheduling, Microsoft is getting ready to show off its first-party resolution upscaler at this year's Game Developer Conference in San Francisco. Though this is more of an industry event rather than a conference for the consumer, the presence of DirectSR is quite exciting.


As the GDC description notes, DirectSR is supposed to be an all-in-one resolution upscaling solution integrated into Windows itself. The notion that Microsoft is working on its own AI-based upscaler isn't new as such, but it is a bit of a surprise that it'd get shown off in such relatively short order. We've seen an OS-level resolution upscaler make its way to widespread gaming audiences with Valve's Steam Deck. In fact, the FSR integration present on the Deck may offer an idea of some of the …
articles.title: Microsoft’s standardized Super Resolution upscaler is getting revealed soon

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
Even though many of us may see Skyrim as one of the greatest RPGs of all time, there's no denying that it's a painfully flawed game. We know this, and that's why modders are always working to make sure Bethesda's aging epic maintains some degree of relevancy.


This mod in particular is pretty simple, but quite effective. As spotted by PC Gamer,  Nexus Mods user wSkeever recently uploaded "Simplicity of Stalking - Automatically Follow NPCs." As the name suggests, this gives you the ability to follow a character in Skyrim without having to do that awkward run/walk by their side in order to keep up.




We've all been there. We all know how irritating it is that an NPC's amble is faster than our walk, but slower than our run. Well, wSkeever's mod fixes that.


Even if they don't want to be followed


As the video above shows, simply targeting a character and activating the "Follow" option will make it so you walk a few paces behind them. Instructions say that, to stop following, simply press "any movement or attack controls."


You'll also need to download a few other mods for your game before you can use this one. Outside that, you're good to go. In fact, not only can the Dragonborn now follow people at a comfortable pace, it also works through loading screens as well.


Of course, while it's likely you'll use the mod mainly for following quest NPCs when they're escorting you somewhere, it can also be used on anyone, as far as I can tell. I'm not saying you should be stalking Skyrim residents. What I am saying is that it literally says the word "stalking" in the mod title.

The post Finally, a Skyrim mod that lets you match NPC speeds when you follow them appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Finally, a Skyrim mod that lets you match NPC speeds when you follow them

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
It's finally happening: Dying Light 2's post-apocalyptic civilization has rediscovered guns. As announced months ago, late in 2023, Techland's latest major content update for Dying Light 2 is all about weaponry, celebrating the game's second anniversary with a boom and a bang.


The aptly titled 'Firearms Update' signals the release of Dying Light 2 version 1.15, and though there's much more to the patch than just guns, it's plainly obvious what its main selling point is. Upon installing the Firearms Update, Dying Light 2 players can look forward to five new types of firearms: the Harran/Service Pistol, the Compact SMG, the Military Rifle, and the Combat Shotgun (H&K USP, TEC-9, SG556/ACR hybrid, and kinda-sorta SPAS-12, respectively). 


All of these have already been lovingly shown off o…
articles.title: Dying Light 2 now has guns and a bunch of other novelties

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
If you thought the days of porting Doom onto every possible device known to humanity were over, think again. Now, get ready to slay demons while also maintaining a neat yard. You may be a lover of violent FPS games, but you're also a responsible adult now.


If you happen to have an Automower NERA from Husqvarna, know that an update for the firmware is coming soon which will allow you to play classic Doom. Just to clarify, it won't turn your garden into the realms of hell. Rather, you'll be able to control it on the robotic lawnmower's screen.




There's even a pretty badass trailer for it. According to the Husqvarna website, once the update is live, the game will be playable "using the robotic lawnmower’s onboard display and controls." You'll navigate with the control knob, while the STA…
articles.title: Literally mow down demons as Doom comes to this robotic lawnmower

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
As the go-to digital storefront for many PC gamers, Steam has dominated the market for the better part of 20 years. Aside from the fact that it has millions of games in its growing selection, regular sales and events continue to be a mild threat to a lot of people's finances.


With that in mind, the latest Steam event will commence today and, much like the Pirates vs. Ninjas sale that took place in January, this one also pits one foe against another. In this case, the Dinos vs. Robots Fest will have the large, scaly creatures of yesteryear fighting it out against the automatons of the futuristic age.




That is to say, there'll be some games in the event that cater to lovers of either dinosaurs or robots. Obvious, really, when you think about it.


And robot dinosaurs, can't forget about them


The above trailer may whet your appetite. As always, we can never be 100% sure what's going to be in each sale, but the teaser gives clips from some notable games.


For example, we get glimpses of Jurassic World Evolution and LEGO Jurassic World for all you dino lovers. Then there's footage from Detroit: Become Human and Terminator: Resistance if bots and mechanoids are more your thing. 


And to bridge the gap, it looks like Horizon Zero Dawn is going in the fest as well. Because in this crazy world, why can't we have a little bit of both? The Steam sale will go on for the week, ending March 4. 

The post Steam’s Dinos vs. Robots Fest begins today appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Steam’s Dinos vs. Robots Fest begins today

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
A good part of the Internet has already sung high praise for the OG Tomb Raider trilogy remaster's loving determination to rejuvenate the classic. I'm glad it has. Being alone in finding it quite a marvel would leave me feeling pretty sad and possibly stupid.


One aspect of the remastered trilogy that I believe I haven't seen enough praise for, however, is the game's achievements, which I absolutely adore. There's something for everyone here. Some achievements are expected, some are difficult to find, some are hilarious, and many are straight-up bonkers.


Tomb Raider I-III Remastered has some of the funniest achievements I've ever seen


To drive my point across, I believe that there's no better example than the fact that there are achievements for killing bald enemies, specifically in d…
articles.title: The Tomb Raider I-III Remastered achievements are utterly bizarre (and amazing)

articles.author: Tim Harding
articles.description:
[Update: As of 6:54PM ET on February 23, official Call of Duty social accounts have shared that a fix is on the way. The team notes that "players will continue to see progression being restored across impacted games," and Champions Quest/Ranked Play will continue to be disabled until the progression fix is fully rolled out.]


Logging into Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 today is quite the ride. Players have seen their rank drop to level 1 overnight, in addition to the server errors being delivered in certain game modes. Particularly Zombies, but also other modes, have displayed a 'Minot Hawthorne' error, or just a never-ending loading screen, which prevents the player from playing. The developer is working on solutions, while temporarily disabling some modes while it's being fixed.


Ranke…
articles.title: Call of Duty temporarily disables ranked play and Zombies amid progression issues (Update)

articles.author: Christian Dawson
articles.description:
The hits keep coming and they don't stop coming for Rocksteady as its parent company, Warner Bros. Games, is disappointed in the performance of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League. Like a poorly made macaroni picture, it looks like this one isn't going up on the fridge.


Warner Bros. Discovery CFO Gunnar Wiedenfels spoke on the 4th Quarter 2023 Earnings Webcast regarding Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League.



"This year, Suicide Squad, one of our key videogame releases in 2024, has fallen short of our expectations since its release earlier in the quarter, setting our games business up for a tough year-over-year comp in Q1."




Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League has been on a decline since release with many players, myself included, being unable to play the supervillain looter …
articles.title: Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League fell short of Warner Bros.’ expectations

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
I realized a long time ago I was probably never going to be good at poker. It's not that I'm bad at assessing risk; worse, I just don't care. When I used to play casual games in-between classes in school, I'd go all-in on bad hands. I'd swap cards for a flush that probably wouldn't show up. So imagine my surprise when Balatro, a deckbuilding poker roguelite, asked me to lean into those bad habits.


Developed by LocalThunk and published by Playstack, Balatro made a bit of a splash during the recent Steam Next Fest. So when people started talking it up in the full release on February 20, I had a feeling I should put this on what I call my "temperature check" radar: dip a toe in, play a few rounds, and see if the hype is real. So I booted it up, expecting a bit of card-counting fun. 


Image…
articles.title: Balatro is a deckbuilding, rule-breaking poker game I can’t get enough of

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
I have a number of valuable games in my collection. Some I acquired through lucky timing, others I’ve actually shelled out for, but all of them are the result of questionable priorities. None are as valuable as my copy of Little Samson.


As of today, Little Samson is worth more than two months of rent for my small, one-bedroom apartment in a nowhere town. That’s really depressing because it both illustrates how ridiculous the collectors market is for video games and how ridiculously expensive it is just to afford a roof over my head for a fraction of a year.


But I don’t collect games to pretend I have some sort of valuable asset. I collect them to play and appreciate. And to demonstrate this, I put Little Samson in my NES. Then I kind of wiggled it around a bit to get it to display prop…
articles.title: Little Samson on NES asks how much you’ll pay for a gem

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
A massive sweep of layoffs has rocked various Sony first-party studios today, including Naughty Dog, Guerilla Games, and Insomniac. Another victim is Firesprite Games, the UK studio behind The Playroom games and The Persistence, and an additional casualty from that studio is reportedly a new Twisted Metal title.
According to Bloomberg’s Jason Schreier, Firesprite had a Twisted Metal game in the works that has now been canceled. He reports that the game was a live-service title was very early in development, so it was not yet officially greenlit. You can read his full report here. 
NEW: As part of today's mass layoff, Sony has canceled a Twisted Metal live-service game that was in development at UK-based studio Firesprite, Bloomberg has learned.
https://t.co/pvCDsS7yxe
February 27, 2024
Twisted Metal was PlayStation’s original flagship series, launching a couple of months after the PS1 was released in North America in the fall of 1995. The series includes eight sequels/spin-offs, the last of which remains the 2012 reboot for PS3. Peacock’s well-received live-action series has at least kept the series alive and is getting a second season. 
The number of layoffs to hit Firespirte is currently unknown. Sony acquired Firesprite in 2021, where it helped co-develop Horizon Call of the Mountain with Guerrilla Games. 900 employees have been laid off across several Sony 1st-party studios in various department. Blood & Truth creators London Studio has been shut down entirely. PlayStation Studios Hermen Hulst has cited overgrowth as the reason for the layoffs, and that the publisher has examined its portfolio of upcoming projects to determine which ones will cease production. It would appear that whatever this Twisted Metal project would have been, it's among several titles getting the axe. 
[Source: Bloomberg]
articles.title: Twisted Metal Game Reportedly Canceled By Sony Amid Mass Layoffs

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
A video game based on the Paranormal Activity film franchise has been announced. Developed by Darkstone Digital, makers of the 2022 horror game The Mortuary Assistant, along with publisher DreadXP and Paramount Pictures, the upcoming game is slated to release in 2026. 
Like the films, Paranormal Activity will feature found-footage-style gameplay as well as a “Haunt System,” which dynamically changes the types of scares that unfold based on players’ actions. Unfortunately, a brief teaser trailer doesn’t do much but show some logos, so we may be waiting a while to see the game in action. 


“We are thrilled to work with Paramount Game Studios and to have the opportunity to bring the world of Paranormal Activity to gamers everywhere,” said Epic Pictures CEO and DreadXP producer Patrick Ewald in a press release. “The films are steeped in rich lore and creative scares, and under the stewardship of creative director Brian Clarke, DreadXP’s Paranormal Activity video game will honor those core tenets and offer horror fans one of our most terrifying games yet.”
Paranormal Activity has no announced platforms. It’s not the franchise’s first foray into video games. A 2017 game called Paranormal Activity: The Lost Soul was released for PS4 and PC and was playable in VR.
articles.title: Paranormal Activity Game Announced By Creators Of The Mortuary Assistant

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
After recently revealing the full launch roster for WWE 2K24, we now know the superstars arriving post-launch. 2K has revealed the five DLC packs rolling out throughout the year, and they include the Best in the World, one of the biggest female superstar signings in recent memory, and even a Grammy-nominated recording artist. 
CM Punk headlines this DLC roster, marking his first appearance in a WWE game since WWE 2K15 in 2014 (the year he walked out of the company). It would appear the Voice of the Voiceless’ recent social media campaign to be included in the 2K24’s DLC plans paid off faster than expected, and he’s part of the first pack, no less. I smell a work, but it’s good to have him back in an official in-game capacity, regardless.
Other big highlights include Jade Cargill, Pat McAfee, and 2K24 soundtrack curator and award-winning music artist Post Malone. Check out the full list of superstars in each pack below.
